questions.question_text: What is the LEAST expensive AWS Support plan that contains a full set of AWS Trusted Advisor best practice checks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
The correct answer is:

B. AWS Business Support

Explanation:
AWS Business Support provides access to a full set of AWS Trusted Advisor best practice checks. It offers 24/7 access to Cloud Support Engineers and various resources, including Trusted Advisor checks, which help you optimize your AWS usage.

Other options:
A. AWS Enterprise Support: This is a more advanced support plan that includes all features of Business Support, plus additional features like a Technical Account Manager (TAM), but it is more expensive.

C. AWS Developer Support: This plan provides technical support for development and testing environments, but it does not include the full set of Trusted Advisor checks.

D. AWS Basic Support: This is the free tier, and it does not provide access to Trusted Advisor checks.

Selected Answer: B
B. AWS Business Support

Selected Answer: B
AWS Business Support provides a cost-effective option that includes access to the full set of AWS Trusted Advisor best practice checks. It offers 24/7 technical support, access to AWS Trusted Advisor, and additional support features such as chat and email support.
Aはなぜ違うの？

Selected Answer: B
full set of AWS Trusted Advisor only available on business or enterprise support, so ans is B.
Correcting myself. Answer should be D. AWS Basic Support is the most affordable AWS Support plan and includes access to AWS Trusted Advisor

comments.content:
B is the correct answer. Core checks are included in Basic Support, but the question is asking for full set. For that you need at the minimum Business Support.

discussion.content: B. AWS Basic Support is the most affordable AWS Support plan and includes access to AWS Trusted Advisor

agreed, check out: https://www.amazonaws.cn/en/support/compare-plans/

Selected Answer: B
AWS Basic Support and AWS Developer Support customers can access core security checks and checks for service quotas. AWS Business Support and AWS Enterprise Support customers can access all checks, including cost optimization, security, fault tolerance, performance, and service quotas.

Selected Answer: B
Amazon CloudFront is a content delivery network (CDN) offered by AWS that helps deliver content, including videos, with low latency and high transfer speeds.

CloudFront has a vast network of edge locations located globally, which reduces the distance between users and the content they are trying to access. When a user requests a video, CloudFront delivers it from the edge location nearest to the user, resulting in reduced latency.

Selected Answer: B
The Reliability pillar focuses on designing systems that can tolerate failures and remain operational even in the face of disruptions. It includes strategies for fault tolerance, high availability, disaster recovery, and the ability to scale resources dynamically.

The AWS Well-Architected Framework consists of five pillar;
1- Operational Excellence
2- Security
3- Reliability
4- Performance Efficiency
5- Cost Optimization

discussion.content:
Vote for A.
Amazon Doc says:
Changing the AWS Support plan does not require root access. You can change the support plan for your AWS account using the AWS Support Plans console or the AWS CLI.

Selected Answer: A
he correct answer is:

A. Viewing billing information

Justification:
The AWS account root user has full access to all AWS resources and services, including tasks that involve account-level management. Some actions that require the root user credentials include:

Viewing billing information
Changing AWS account settings (such as email or payment method)
Managing AWS account permissions
Why Not the Other Options?
B. Changing the AWS Support plan → Changing the AWS Support plan can be done by an IAM user with appropriate permissions, not necessarily the root user.
C. Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances → This task can be done by IAM users with the appropriate permissions, so it doesn’t require root user access.
D. Opening an AWS Support case → AWS Support cases can be opened by IAM users if they have the necessary permissions, so the root user is not required.

Selected Answer: A
All others can be done by other IAM users/roles.

Selected Answer: A
Visualización de la información de facturación:
El usuario raíz es la única cuenta que puede acceder a la información de facturación de la cuenta de AWS, sin posibilidad de delegar este permiso a otros usuarios a través de IAM.

Cambio del plan de soporte:
No se requiere necesariamente el usuario raíz. Un usuario IAM con permisos administrativos puede realizar esta acción si se le conceden los permisos adecuados.

Selected Answer: A
Viewing billing information

Changing the AWS Support plan requires root user credentials because it involves account-level changes, and only the root user can modify critical settings like the support plan.

Viewing billing information can be done by users with appropriate permissions without needing the root user credentials.

Starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances can be performed by IAM users with the correct permissions; it does not require root user credentials.

Opening an AWS Support case can be done by any user with the necessary permissions and does not require root user credentials.

B is not correct answer.

discussion.content:
Think of this as a cloud, platform, aws, devops, etc engineer working with AWS in a company environment. 

Show me a legitimate company that regularly wants basic view/list/describe on Billing to be isolated to the root account, which should almost NEVER be used. While the modify action on the company's/organization's AWS support plan (Enterprise Support plan is $15k/month MINIMUM) is regularly performed and should be shared via IAM roles or Identity Center's permission sets? That would make no sense. You'd even be getting your TAM reaching out to you if your company's AWS Support plan suddenly changed since it's such an impactful change. 

The answer is clearly B although this question appears to be a bit outdated since a root user technically can share BOTH functions with policy based users as of a few months ago.

Actions that can be performed only by the root user:
• Change account settings (account name, email address, root user password, root user access keys)
• View certain tax invoices
• Close your AWS account
• Restore IAM user permissions
• Change or cancel your AWS Support plan
• Register as a seller in the Reserved Instance Marketplace
• Configure an Amazon S3 bucket to enable MFA
• Edit or delete an Amazon S3 bucket policy that includes an invalid VPC ID or VPC endpoint ID
• Sign up for GovCloud

he correct answer is A. Viewing billing information. The AWS account root user is the identity that has complete access to all AWS services and resources in the account1. Anyone who has root user credentials for your AWS account has unrestricted access to all the resources in your account, including billing information1. Therefore, viewing billing information requires using AWS account root user credentials. It is strongly recommended that you do not use the root user for your everyday tasks, even the administrative ones, and safeguard your root user credentials1. Instead, you should create IAM users and use them for everyday tasks1. Tasks B, C, and D can be performed by IAM users with appropriate permissions.

The task that requires using AWS account root user credentials is:

A. Viewing billing information.

To view billing information for an AWS account, including the detailed breakdown of costs and usage, the root user credentials are typically required. The root user has full access and permissions to manage all aspects of the AWS account, including billing-related activities.

Changing the AWS Support plan (B), starting and stopping Amazon EC2 instances (C), and opening an AWS Support case (D) can generally be performed by users with appropriate IAM (Identity and Access Management) credentials and permissions without relying on the root user credentials.

However, it's worth noting that best practices recommend using IAM roles and individual user accounts with appropriate permissions rather than relying on the root user credentials for day-to-day operations in order to enhance security and manage access more effectively.

Therefore, the correct answer is A. Viewing billing information.

AWS account owner
If you create a single AWS account, only the AWS account owner (AWS account root user) has access to view and manage billing information. IAM users cannot access billing data until the account owner activates

questions.question_text: Which AWS service provides domain registration, DNS routing, and service health checks?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Amazon Route53 has a scalable and highly available DNS wed service that helps route users to application by translating domain names into IP addresses.

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon Route 53

"Amazon Route 53 is a highly available and scalable Domain Name System (DNS) web service. Route 53 connects user requests to internet applications running on AWS or on-premises."

https://aws.amazon.com/route53/

Selected Answer: B
Amazon Route 53 is a scalable domain name system (DNS) web service that allows you to register and manage domain names, route traffic to AWS resources or other external endpoints, and perform health checks to monitor the availability of your resources. It provides reliable and cost-effective domain registration and DNS management, making it suitable for various use cases including website hosting, application routing, and global traffic management.

Selected Answer: B
B is the answer.

Selected Answer: B
https://aws.amazon.com/route53/faqs/
B. Route 53 --> DNS

questions.question_text:
A bank needs to store recordings of calls made to its contact center for 6 years. The recordings must be accessible within 48 hours from the time they are requested.
Which AWS service will provide a secure and cost-effective solution for retaining these files?

discussion.content: I think its B
Someone answered AWS Connect because it's related to call centers, but actually, this question is more about data so B.

Selected Answer: B
Amazon glacier is secure ,durable and low cost storage class for data archiving

Selected Answer: B
B. Amazon S3 Glacier

https://aws.amazon.com/s3/storage-classes/glacier/

"To save even more on long-lived archive storage such as compliance archives and digital media preservation, choose S3 Glacier Deep Archive, the lowest cost storage in the cloud with data retrieval within twelve hours."
Option :B and will avail the feature of AWS glacier and choose the option as Bulk Reterival

Selected Answer: B
Amazon S3 Glacier is designed for long-term data archiving and backup. It provides secure, durable, and scalable object storage with flexible retrieval options. With Amazon S3 Glacier, you can store large amounts of data at a lower cost compared to other storage options. The data is stored in archives and can be accessed within a predefined retrieval time (such as 48 hours) when needed.
